intro: Grewia malacocarpa, commonly known as the sour plum or red sour plum, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe, containing a single seed. The fruits are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of edible pulp. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
